metadata.title: CVE-2020-9283 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
golang.org/x/crypto before v0.0.0-20200220183623-bac4c82f6975 for Go allowsa panic during signature verification in the golang.org/x/crypto/sshpackage. A client can attack an SSH server that accepts public keys. Also,a server can attack any SSH client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-golang-x-crypto-dev - 1:0.0~git20200221.2aa609c-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-go.crypto package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.0~git20200221.2aa609c-1').
